subject: Design
title: The Roach Motel: Easy In, Impossible Out
description: One-minute skill: The Roach Motel: Easy In, Impossible Out.

hook.text: Signing up takes one click. Canceling requires a phone call, a survey, and a 30-day wait. Sound familiar?

buildup.text: The 'roach motel' pattern makes it deliberately easy to enter a commitment and hard to leave.

discovery.text: Amazon Prime's cancellation flow once required six clicks through guilt-trip screens.

twist.text: The FTC fined Amazon and sued them specifically over their cancellation dark patterns.

climax.text: Regulators now require that canceling must be as easy as signing up. Design ethics becomes law.

punchline.text: If leaving is harder than joining, the design is a trap.

quiz.question: What is the 'roach motel' dark pattern?
options: Easy sign-up but deliberately difficult cancellation
